TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {54137=Nick Albertson coaches golf and football. He coached Deerfield’s golf team to its first undefeated season in 2005 and again in 2006. The group posted an 11-0-1 record over the course of the spring and won the Kingswood-Oxford Tournament at season's end. In 2000, the squad also won that tournament., 55000=While Chip Davis has served as head coach of the boys lacrosse team at Deerfield, the program has developed into one of the most successful programs in New England. The team has finished atop Western New England Boys Lacrosse Division I in eleven of the past thirteen years, winning that title outright in 2002, 2007, 2011 & 2013, and splitting the title on seven other occasions. After the 2004 season, Chip was named Western NE Coach of the Year  and in 2011, Deerfield Lacrosse was given the Sportsmanship Award by the Western Mass Officials Association.  Chip also serves as an assistant coach with the football team in the fall., 52210=at Away on September 10, 2015 - 3:00 pm, 53286=Mike attended Hobart College in Geneva, NY, where he earned all-conference honors in football. He was also a member of Hobart’s baseball team. A talented multi-sport athlete, Mike later went to on the capture the New England Region INSICLO Squash Championship in 1979., 53082=A 27-year veteran of New England prep school squash, Mike Silipo teaches history, and coaches squash and football. Mike took over Deerfield’s football program from the legendary Jim Smith in 1996.}
textBeforeTable: Events Deerfield teams are led by a strong coaching staff including Michael Silipo, Nicholas Albertson, Charles Davis, and Mark Ott. Deerfield continues to have one of the premier prep school football programs in New England. We have a varsity and junior varsity team, totaling approximately 70 players. Both teams play an eight game schedule, and since we are seriously committed to developing a strong program, coaches use identical concepts in all aspects of the game. This allows players to move between teams, if and when the need arises. Deerfield football players work hard on and off the field; they play with dignity whether in victory or defeat; and they strive to uphold the standards necessary to play and succeed as Deerfield student-athletes.
